intro: Lipochaeta lobata, commonly known as the narrowleaf lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as woodlands and coastal areas. Lipochaeta lobata is adapted to arid conditions and is an important component of native plant communities in its range.
